revised_title: Electroweak Tests Using Leptonic Decays of the Z Boson at LEP
tldr: The article presents results from the Large Electron Positron Collider at CERN, focusing on electroweak tests using leptonic decays of the Z boson. Measurements of partial widths and differential cross-sections provide electroweak parameter determinations, which are compared to Standard Model predictions. These tests either confirm the Standard Model or help infer the mass of the top quark.
